entry.name: unwrap
entry.title: .unwrap()

argument.name: selector
argument.desc: A selector to check the parent element against. If an element's parent does not match the selector, the element won't be unwrapped.

entry.desc: Remove the parents of the set of matched elements from the DOM, leaving the matched elements in their place.

longdesc.p: The .unwrap() method removes the element's parent and returns the unwrapped content. This is effectively the inverse of the .wrap() method. The matched elements (and their siblings, if any) replace their parents within the DOM structure.

example.desc: Wrap/unwrap a div around each of the paragraphs.
